p: The mechanism of antimicrobial action of EOs is complex and depends on their chemical composition and the quantity of the major single compounds. The antifungal mechanism of action of EOs is similar for antibacterial. Many reports revealed that constituents of EOs mixture cause cell membrane damage; moreover, they influence many other cellular activities including energy production [ 8]. The antimicrobial effect may be linked to reduced membrane potentials, the disruption of proton pumps, and the depletion of the ATP [ 14]. The effect of EOs activity is also the coagulation of cell content, cytoplasm leakage, and finally cell apoptosis or necrosis, leading to cell death [ 8].
